SuspiciousEqualsMethodName.description:
Description

The method name and parameter number are suspiciously close toObject.equals, which can denote an
intention to override it. However, the method does not overrideObject.equals, but overloads it instead.
OverloadingObject.equalsmethod is confusing for other programmers, error-prone and hard to maintain,
especially when using inheritance, because@Overrideannotations used in subclasses can provide a false
sense of security. For more information onObject.equalsmethod, see Effective Java, 3rd Edition,
Item 10: Obey the general contract when overriding equals.

Example(s):

Use this rule by referencing it:
SuspiciousEqualsMethodName.option: This rule has no specific options.
